alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Marion, east central Stewart, Webster and southwestern Sumter Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Draneville to Bridges Crossroad, and moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Preston, Richland, Plains, Weston, Seminole, Friendship, Church Hill, Centerpoint, Dumas, Draneville and Leveretts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
